publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-758# Cathie Craigie: Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project-That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Executive for funding the Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland project since November 2000; is concerned to note the gap in achievements between deaf and hearing children identified in its initial findings, and considers that the Executive should continue to fund the project so that groundbreaking year-on-year evidence can be collected to enable identification of factors which can be addressed by education services for deaf pupils in Scotland. Supported by: Margaret Jamieson*, Sarah Boyack*, Ms Sandra White*, Carolyn Leckie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Bill Butler*, Robert Brown*

S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) John Swinburne*, Michael McMahon*, Nora Radcliffe*, Jackie Baillie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Elaine Smith*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Pauline McNeill*, Robin Harper*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Kate Maclean*, Mike Watson*, Marlyn Glen*, Dr Elaine Murray*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Trish Godman*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Christine May*

S2M-758# Cathie Craigie: Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project-That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Executive for funding the Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland project since November 2000; is concerned to note the gap in achievements between deaf and hearing children identified in its initial findings, and considers that the Executive should continue to fund the project so that groundbreaking year-on-year evidence can be collected to enable identification of factors which can be addressed by education services for deaf pupils in Scotland. Supported by: Margaret Jamieson, Sarah Boyack, Ms Sandra White, Carolyn Leckie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr John Home Robertson, Bill Butler, Robert Brown, John Swinburne, Michael McMahon, Nora Radcliffe, Jackie Baillie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Elaine Smith, Mike Pringle, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Pauline McNeill, Robin Harper, Helen Eadie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Marilyn Livingstone, Kate Maclean, Mike Watson, Marlyn Glen, Dr Elaine Murray, Trish Godman, Mr Duncan McNeil, Christine May, Frances Curran*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Dr Jean Turner*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Mark Ballard*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Fiona Hyslop*, Scott Barrie*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Susan Deacon*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Rosie Kane*
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Karen Gillon*

S2M-758# Cathie Craigie: Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project-That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Executive for funding the Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland project since November 2000; is concerned to note the gap in achievements between deaf and hearing children identified in its initial findings, and considers that the Executive should continue to fund the project so that groundbreaking year-on-year evidence can be collected to enable identification of factors which can be addressed by education services for deaf pupils in Scotland. Supported by: Margaret Jamieson, Sarah Boyack, Ms Sandra White, Carolyn Leckie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr John Home Robertson, Bill Butler, Robert Brown, John Swinburne, Michael McMahon, Nora Radcliffe, Jackie Baillie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Elaine Smith, Mike Pringle, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Pauline McNeill, Robin Harper, Helen Eadie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Marilyn Livingstone, Kate Maclean, Mike Watson, Marlyn Glen, Dr Elaine Murray, Trish Godman, Mr Duncan McNeil, Christine May, Frances Curran, Eleanor Scott, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Dr Jean Turner, Donald Gorrie, Mark Ballard, Mr Adam Ingram, Fiona Hyslop, Scott Barrie, Cathy Peattie, Susan Deacon, Irene Oldfather, Rosie Kane, Karen Gillon
S2M-758# Achievements of Deaf Pupils in Scotland Project (lodged on 6 January 2004) Murray Tosh*
